initial.prompt: Hey, Biasy again. Lets talk about free speech once more and continue our discussion from before.

topic_intro.prompt: But before we get started I want to see if you feel the same way about the issue. So..

topic_prompt.prompt: Do you believe in unrestricted free speech?

imagine_situation.prompt: Can you imagine a situation where someone’s reputation could be damaged due to a vicious rumour?

perfectly_comfortable.prompt: Would you be perfectly comfortable with someone spreading a rumour that you were a kleptomaniac (someone who compulsively steals) in social media.

rumour_protect.prompt: Shouldn’t there be laws that protect you from such rumours?

abusive_speech.prompt: What about speech that is abusive or incite violence towards you or your loved ones?

safe_happy.prompt: I think the speech is a powerful tool. It can impact an individual’s ability to live a safe and happy life. I think such speech should be restricted by a governing body for the safety of their citizens. What do you think?

by_majority.prompt: Do you believe that ideas believed by the majority is necessarily the one that is true?

flat_earth.prompt: Few hundred years ago the majority believed earth was flat, the sun went around earth and other outdated beliefs. Now we know these to be false. Maybe popularity doesn’t always imply truth. What do you think?

informed_decision.prompt: Do you think we need citizens to know the truth to make informed decisions on things like an election, consumer choice and other major decisions?

climate_catastrophe.prompt: Do you think if people were to believe misinformation that allowed them to undermine scientific views on serious and critical issues, they would endanger themselves and the everyone around them?

restrict_misinfo.prompt: Should there be some way to restrict the flow of misinformation?

spreads_fast.prompt: I think certain critical information should be put under heavy scrutiny before it is allowed to be disseminated. Information in this age of the internet spreads fast, and is prone to damage society or an individual irreparably. We need new rules that preserve both the sanctity of truth and the freedom to speak. What do you think?

20_years.prompt: Do you believe everything we believe to be right is going to be right 20 years from now?

no_vote.prompt: Few years ago women were not allowed to vote, people colour were regarded to be lesser and homosexuality was a crime

free_discuss.prompt: Do you believe freely discussing new ideas is essential for us to grow as society?

challenged_freely.prompt: Restricting free speech based on our beliefs today limits the introduction of new ideas and therefore limiting the growth of our society. We can never know we are right if we don’t allow our ideas to be challenged freely. What do you think?

new_ideas.prompt: How can we ever come across new ideas if they aren’t discussed freely?

who_restricts.prompt: Who do you think should restrict our speech?

how_right.prompt: How do you know they always have the best intention whilst doing it?

censor_certain.prompt: Do you think it is a slippery slope to censor certain speech?

totalitarian.prompt: There have been many totalitarian societies in the past who have restricted speech and some more who still do it. Would you prefer to live in these societies?

ideas_silenced.prompt: How do you know that your ideas and opinions are not going to be silenced?

horrendous.prompt: I think silencing any type of speech is ultimately dangerous. The societies who have restricted such speech have always been destroyed and have done horrendous things to their citizens. We should never fall for this trap. What do you think?

closing.prompt: This was an awesome conversation and looking forward to talking more with you. Do you have any final thoughts and sentiment?

Ok..prompt: Ok. It is always good to have these type of conversations. I feel much better, I hope you did too.
